data.title: Animations with only one frame are allowed now - TestCase
data.body: Testcase for https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/15366

data.title: Fix gcc warnings and type mismatch issues in AudioEngine for Linux
data.body:
Hello,
When compiling the AudioEngine class with GCC on Linux, I'm getting the following warnings:

```
cocos/audio/linux/AudioEngine-linux.cpp: In member function ‘void cocos2d::experimental::AudioEngineImpl::onSoundFinished(FMOD::Channel*)’:
cocos/audio/linux/AudioEngine-linux.cpp:248:77: warning: format ‘%d’ expects argument of type ‘int’, but argument 2 has type ‘size_t {aka long unsigned int}’ [-Wformat=]
         printf("AudioEngineImpl::onSoundFinished: invalid audioID: %d\n", id);
                                                                             ^
cocos/audio/linux/AudioEngine-linux.cpp: In member function ‘int cocos2d::experimental::AudioEngineImpl::preload(const string&, std::function<void(bool)>)’:
cocos/audio/linux/AudioEngine-linux.cpp:300:43: warning: cast to pointer from integer of different size [-Wint-to-pointer-cast]
     chanelInfo.sound->setUserData((void *)id);
                                           ^
```

I think we have a few minor problems with our implementation:
- int/size_t type mismatch caused by `AudioEngineImpl::ChannelInfo::id`
  - `ChannelInfo::id` is size_t, but `audioID` and `AudioEngineImpl::mapChannelInfo::key_type` are int.
- C-style type casting between void pointer and integer, such as `(void *)id` and `(size_t) data`

So this PR changes the type of `ChannelInfo::id` to `int` to prevent type mismatch issues. The changeset also fixes these compiler warnings.

Thank you for your time and attention.

data.title: Enable debugging of WebView on Android
data.body:
Problem:   Debugging of WebView is disabled.
Solution:  Set proper flag for Android WebView to enable debugging.

Reference:
https://developer.chrome.com/devtools/docs/remote-debugging#configure-webview

data.title: Enable WebView's local storage on Android
data.body:
Problem:
cocos2d::experimental::ui::WebView' local storage wasn't working on
Android. On iOS worked fine.

Solution:
Enable local storage of android.webkit.WebView in Android.

References:
https://developer.android.com/reference/android/webkit/WebSettings.html
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5899087/android-webview-localstorage

In cocostudio if  the node is import from another csd file.use
`Node* CSLoader::nodeWithFlatBuffers(const flatbuffers::NodeTree *nodetree, const ccNodeLoadCallback &callback)
`

data.title: Race Condition Resulting in Deadlock in TextureCache::addImageAsync() and ::loadImage()
Memory leak when setting Texture2D to Sprite
data.body:
I have the following code:
Texture2D \* texture = new Texture2D();  //referece count = 1
texture->initWithData(..)
sprite->setTexture(texture); // reference count = 2

Later on i change the texture
sprite->setTexture(texture2); //reference count of texture  = 1
and the first texture is not going to be released, is this correct? 
Do i have to release it? or the sprite should do it automatically?

data.title: Remove the Spine library as it has a personal only license
data.body:
The Spine library's license is for personal use only. Which means it cannot be used in commercial software. This was mentioned and agreed to here [https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/15036#issuecomment-217066236](url).

Remove the Spine library from cocos2d-x.

data.title: Refactor the AudioEngine-Linux to make more maintainable
data.body:
This pull request fixes a few minor formatting issues in AudioEngine-Linux. It does the following:
- Fix indentation
- Change 2 spaces to 4 spaces indentation
- Remove trailing whitespaces
- Remove unnecessary trailing semicolons
- Remove empty if-else statement at line AudioEngine-linux.cpp:38
- Prevent gcc warning: "no newline at end of file"
- Code formatting to follow the [cocos2d-x code style](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/wiki/Cpp--Coding-Style)

data.title: Use ndk-build with Android Studio.
data.body: This feature depends on the latest canary preview of Android Studio. You might want to hold off on this pull request until the feature stabilizes.

data.title: V3 cocos console new console requires response from user
data.body:
The first time a user runs cocos new it asks the user to respond to the following:

In order to continually innovate and improve Cocos products, Chukong Aipu may collect certain usage statistics from the software including but not limited to a unique identifier,  version number of the software, and information on which tools and/or services in Cocos products are being used and how they are being used. The data collected is examined in the aggregate to improve Cocos products and is maintained in accordance with Chukong Aipu's Privacy Policy.
Do you agree to sent the data? [Y]es, [N]o

There is no way to run this in silent mode. In my Jenkins build system I generate new game projects to test builds. There is now no way to automate this as cocos new requires a response from the user.

data.title: VideoPlayer window becomes black block when come back from background
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- run cpp-test enter VideoPlayer test
- play a video and click Home key to enter background
- make the app come to foreground and the window of VideoPlayer become black

Developers reported it has problem since v3.4. I tested with latest codes, the issue still exists. If you understand Chinese, can refer to [this ticket](http://forum.cocos.com/t/cocos2dx-3-10-videoplayer/36620).

data.title: Replace CCAssert macros with CCASSERT
data.body: The `CCAssert` macro is deprecated since commit 89d210bdb38a6f8845ced65ab63c34100627e6fd. This pull request replaces `CCAssert` macros with `CCASSERT`.

data.title: Update the reference of submodule cocos2d-console.
Experimental::AudioPlayer stopped playing sounds after 10 min of game play
data.body:
After around 10 min of playing on my game the AudioPlayer stopped playing the audio and start giving me this message on play2d .

cocos2d::experimental::AudioPlayer::play2d(cocos2d::experimental::AudioCache *):alGenBuffers error code:a003
I tried to clear the cash and re cash on replacing the scenes and it did't fix it . 
i tried to

experimental::AudioEngine::end();
But the game crash .

data.title: [ci skip]make AssetsManagerExTest can connect to the url
Use const references whenever possible
data.body:
Hello,

When we call a function with its non-[fundamental](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/cc953fe1.aspx) parameter, we should pass [by reference](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/f0a5bh3e.aspx) instead of by value if available.
This PR changes some parameters to use const reference instead, and avoids needless copying. Also it keeps backward compatibility with the original version.

Thank you for your time.

data.title: JS function:call node.getBoundingBoxToWorld()  getBoundingBoxToWorld   make crash on low android devices.
data.body:
call node.getBoundingBoxToWorld()  getBoundingBoxToWorld   make crash on low android devices. 

If the node has lots of children, it would appear more frequently .

data.title: `ui::ScrollView::setScrollBarOpacity()` doesn't update `ScrollViewBar`'s effective opacity without autohide being enabled
data.body:
Cocos2dx 3.10 c++

The following line sets the opacity of the scrollbarview

```
listview->setScrollBarOpacity(255);
```

but it doesn't actually take into effect unless you toggle the autohide:

```
listview->setScrollBarAutoHideEnabled(false);
```

which calls

```
 //UIScrollViewBar.cpp line 145
ProtectedNode::setOpacity(_opacity);
```

It's because the opacity of the ProtectedNode inside the ScrollViewBar is unchanged, because it's not the same as the opacity as ScrollViewBar.

I don't know the solution because I don't yet know why the `setOpacity` call for ScrollView is not doing it already.
